intro: Crepinella varisiana, commonly known as the variable crepinella, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively obscure in horticultural circles.
